snippet: Recent turmoil, including the resignation plans of the prime minister and the anticipated return of Silvio Berlusconi to politics, had effects that rippled out from Rome across the euro zone.
abstract: Italian stock and bond prices fall after weekend of political turmoil in Italy gives rise to fears that country is headed for renewed instability; yields, or interest rates, rise; bonds of Spain also come under renewed pressure.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and DAVID JOLLY
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Rome and David Jolly from Paris. Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Madrid and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Recent turmoil, including the resignation plans of the prime minister and the anticipated return of Silvio Berlusconi to politics, had effects that rippled out from Rome across the euro zone.

headline.seo: Bonds in Spain and Italy Shaken by Italian Politics
headline.main: Anxiety Over Italy’s Future Devalues Its Bonds, and Spain’s
headline.print_headline: Anxiety Over Italy’s Future Devalues Its Bonds, and Spain’s
